Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: They're back!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oooh yeah... [people chuckle] Jim and Pam!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: How was Puerto Rico? Was it so romantic?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It was.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It really was.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really was.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [voice cracks] I'm so happy for you...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Puerto Rico was awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh my gosh. The honeymoon was great. We met this other couple at the resort, Frank and Benny. We hung out with them a lot.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [goofy voice] Frank and Beans. [laughs] Always makes her laugh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [goofy voice] Frank and beans!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Is there someone there? Who is there? I hear voices, is somebody there?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Is someone there? I can't see you because I'm blind.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Its Jim and Pam, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [gasps] It is?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They're back? Oh! Oh! Oh, Pam! [reaching out with hands at chest level]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And oh, Jim...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hi, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, I haven't see you since my accident that I had when I fell- I fell into the pool of acid, eyes first. Blind guy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Blind-guy McSqueezy. How do I describe it? It is a character I've been workshopping whose lack of vision gets him into all sorts of trouble. The women in my improve class absolutely hate him. [groans]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: So what'd you bring us?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Some candy.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: What else?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's it.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Oh, 'cause you spent so much on the wedding.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [behind Pam, acting out blind-guy, groaning]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's good to be home.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This conversation has two items on the agenda.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Do we have a conversation scheduled?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Number one, do not leave your things on my desk. It's not some kind of personal pen receptacle for you. I don't care how high they promote you, which brings me to item number two... I never formally congratulated you on your promotion, so I'd just like to say... [high voice, holding up wooden mallard] con-quack-ulations!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow, that's... really thoughtful of you, Dwight, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [duck voice] You're welcome! [quacks, laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I inserted a listening device into the belly of the mallard. Now I can observe Jim, trap Jim, and destroy Jim, just like in the Bavarian fairy tale. Only this time, the mallard skins the toad alive. And of course in this version you lose the whole veiled critique of the Kaiser thing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm sorry to have been bugging you all these years.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's a real handsome duck.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mallard. Okay, I'll get out of your hair.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hi!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh, we brought back some Puerto Rican candy.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Coco Leche! That's my favorite!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Awesome! I'll leave it up here so everyone can enjoy it.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, um, let me just check with Michael first.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [laughs] I think it'll be okay.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [laughs] I think it will too, but I'll just check with him, though.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oops, sorry. [slides candy back to Pam] Oops.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have recently taken a lover.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, that's great. Congratulations. Who's the lucky lady?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam's mom.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam's mom, Helene. Remember from your wedding?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You're messing with me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: About what?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You did not have sex with Pam's mom.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, big time.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What kind of car does she drive?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She drives a green camry.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [expletive]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And the seats go all the way down. All the way down.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh my God. [Michael bangs the table] Oh my God.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughs] What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, never tell Pam, and secondly-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, good, a pact. A pact. Although I may have to break it tonight when Helene and I tell Pam over dinner. You alright?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh my God.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [walks in] Hey, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Not now, Toby, my God!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh, Jesus!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Get the hell out of here, idiot.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: What did I do?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, as far as dinner tonight, cancel that, and please, for both our sakes, never, ever, ever see her again.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think you're underestimating Pam. I think more than anything, she wants me to be happy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, not more than anything.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, I have a good thing with the mom-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Don't call her "the mom."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She's right on my way home from work.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Then take a different way home, man!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I di- alright, I'll take surface streets, its- the last thing in the world I would want to do is upset Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, so we're good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Can you change my dinner reservations from four people to two?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Sure. Oh, is it okay if I put out some candy that Pam brought back from Puerto Rico?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sure. Thanks for asking.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Pam, we're all set. [Pam places candy on Erin's desk] Yum.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Frank and beans!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Frank and beans! [both laugh] So what'd we decide for Michael, the bottle of rum, or the seashell alarm clock?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what? Can I have the weekend to decide?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Bottle of rum it is. [takes package out of bag] Alright, shall we?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what, I am really slammed, trying to catch up on everything here and I know that Michael's slammed too. So, maybe we should do this when things are a little less crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Come on, it'll take two seconds.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, it- [high-pitched feedback as Jim starts to leave, feedback changes as he moves, turns over the mallard to see the listening devics, sighs, places mallard back on the desk]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [unwraps rum gift] Oh, wow.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [giggles]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is amazing. I feel like a real Puerto Rican.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Michael, you're all set at Botticelli's. I changed the reservation to two people.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Erin, look. [holds up parrot rum bottle]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Fun!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow, Botticelli's, that sounds like a special occasion.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, no, it's nobody.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [laughs] I don't know. I think Michael has a date.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [chuckles] Hmm... no.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [laughs] I think you have a date.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, I think we should just drop it... 'cause obviously he doesn't want to talk about it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sighs] I don't deserve this, guys.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes, you do.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I don't.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Just take the parrot.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [long exhale]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, back to the old grind.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I was probably going to break up with her anyway.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, that's too bad.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Don't-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam, it is very complicated. There are a lot of moving parts here.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sounds complicated.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, but I mean, if you really like this person, then you should see where it goes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You want me to be happy?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Of course.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Part of the problem is, she is the mother of a close friend of mine.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: More than a friend, a co-worker.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh! Gossip, who is it? Who is it? Who is it, Michael? ...Who?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no, no. Oh, no. Oh, my God! Oh, my God! Nooooo!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That could have gone one of two ways, but I never expected her to get upset.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [screams out in the parking lot, Michael watches from his office window]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [to Michael] You seem tense. Hey, you want me to give you the chills?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There's an egg on your head and the yolk is running down, the yolk is running down...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sighs] Feels good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There's a knife in your back and the blood is gushing down...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm sleeping with Pam's mom. Sometimes, dinner.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ...the blood is gushing down, the blood is gushing down... You know, I really would have appreciated a heads-up that you were into dating mothers. I would have introduced you to mine.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [outside, on cell phone] How could you do this to me? He's my boss! How many times have I complained about him to you? No, I am not being dramatic, you are being crazy!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [singsong voice] Who wants a hot chocolate?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [sighs] Oh, so Dwight gave me this wooden mallard as a gift, and I found a recording device in it. Yes. So, I think if I played it just right I can get Dwight to play out the plot of National Treasure.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You need to be more upset about this. She's your mother too now. Your mother is sleeping with Michael Scott.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Andy, can I talk to you for a second?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Sure thing, Tuna Boss.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [holding up a sign that reads, "Dwight picked the wrong day to put a wooden mallard in my office"]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [in Jim's office] How may I be of service to you?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I am gonna need your advice [starts playing loud opera music, everyone can hear it, Creed starts crying] I was thinking about getting this opera for Dwight's birthday, what do you think?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [both look at Dwight, Jim waves] This aurea is a joke.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What are you thinking?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I was gonna go with this one.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [both look at Dwight who is standing right outside the office] Let me tell you something, if you respect him at all, you will get him something better.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Andy gets up and leaves the office] The Nard Dog... what was that all about?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I know, right?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What were you talking about in there?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Trust me it would only make you mad. [opera continues, Dwight looks at Jim standing outside his office, waves, Jim waves back]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in the conference room leading a meeting] Due to a certain recent incident, corporate has asked all the branches to come up with ideas as to how we can better communicate with our communities.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Is this because of the 60 Minutes segment about working conditions in our Peruvian paper mill?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That was a hit job. If you read the Dunder Mifflin press release it clearly states that they had absolutely nothing to do with that particular cancer cluster. So if there is a lesson to be learned here and I'm not sure that there is, it is that in order to help our communities, we need to put other people's needs ahead of our own.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Haha! Ha ha ha.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And whoever comes up with the best idea gets a $50 gift certificate to the restaurant of his or her choice. [everyone claps and makes comments]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who wants to help the world one step at a time? [Dwight raises his hand] Alright, good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Volunteerism is important. Every weekend I volunteer at the local animal shelter and they need a lot of help down there. Last Sunday I had to put down over 150 pets all by myself.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, that's...

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Paint a mural of Chicano leaders.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I have a way to make Scranton a better place, you could leave it. [laughter]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, I'm out of here, [pretends to leave] see you later guys...

Quote.Speaker: Various
Quote.Text: Get out and stay out, bye...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, oh no here's an idea... conservation...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I love it, conservation. Let's start by conserving our time and stop having these stupid meetings. [stands up and cheers] No more meetings! No more meetings! No more meetings! No more meetings! [Stanley cheers her on in the background]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Anybody else? Who else has an idea?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I have some ideas about conservation...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes! Angela! Please...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Michael leaves to answer his phone] Can you hold down the fort? [on phone] Hey boo!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Thank you. Sure well first of all I think that we could totally...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on phone] What's it... why are you crying?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes! I think we should look into that. If you could just speak up louder...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [to Angela] Shhhh...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Well, for our profit...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [to Angela] Shhh...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on phone] No, no, no, I'll talk to her. I will... No... nobody talks to my baby that way... uh ah... yeah, I'll let you know how it goes. Alright, by pickle.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Who's pickle?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [hangs up phone and walks back into conference room] Pamela Morgan Beesly, you need to apologize to your mother right now.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, I was told I had the floor.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hold on, hold on, what's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nothing... nothing at all... it's all good!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm not apologizing to anyone. Michael owes me an apology.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: For trying to find happiness in the arms of a lover?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Don't call my mother your lover.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes! That's what I'm talking about.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That is not okay dude.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, in my defense...

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Disgusting...

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: She's messed up man...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes! Thank you, welcome to my personal hell!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You have no sense of boundaries Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shut up Oscar. Hey, alright, you know what, clearly I'm outnumbered here, but can I just say one thing, please? What is so wrong about me? I'm caring, I'm generous, I'm sensual. Is it really so horrible that I could possibly go out and find happiness.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Good luck Michael, I hope you find what you're looking for.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Maybe you're right, who are we to...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Shut up Oscar. What is wrong with all of you, he is sleeping with my mother!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't think there's a whole lot of sleeping going on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let's get back to the matter at hand.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Whatever, you know, sleep with my mom, sleep with everybody's mom...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no... no, no...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Whoa, that's my mother you're talking about...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't like the tone here... this is a place of business, you are to listen to others, you are to give others respect, and you are to keep your personal issues out of it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uhh, huh, ho... oooh my God, you are ridiculous!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do not talk to me that way! I am your boss and I may someday be your father, so get out.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You are never going to be my father, you get out!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I hope that you are willing to die in this office, because I am...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Me too...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey. [walks up to Oscar and hands him a report to sign]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [in a sing-songy voice] Pam, how's your day going?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Pam, just for the record, I think you're overreacting a little bit, your mom's old enough to make her own decisions.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, well, thanks Oscar. I was just wondering how would you feel if Michael was sleeping with your mom?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: My mother's in a wheelchair.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, he could still... I'm sorry about that... Oh could I just get you to sign this second page.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [Dwight listening in his ear piece] Ryan, I have to ask you a personal question. Do you think that I should get a Fedora?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Ahh, I don't think so, no...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Well, I think I'd look really hot in one. Where'd you get your fedora?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'd rather not say.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I think I'm gonna get the same fedora as you.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hi Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Dwight storms through the break room listening to Kelly and Ryan in his ear piece] Shh!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [Ryan and Kelly talking] ...it should go with the persona you already have.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Well, I think I have that persona.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Where did you get that mallard?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What the hell is a mallard?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh, Professor Damien D. Duck, Jim gave him to me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, I gave that to him that as a gift, I'm taking that back.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: If you take it back, I'll scream.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [sighs heavily] I'll give you five bucks for it.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Twenty.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ten.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Deal. [pays Ryan and takes the mallard back]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [to Ryan] You're so cool.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: This reminds me, you owe me three bucks for gas.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [walks into Toby's office] Hey Toby, could I talk to you for a minute?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah, sure, what's up?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, I just wanted to apologize for taking that tone with you earlier that was... uncalled for, I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Um, yeah, ah, ah, that means a lot. Thank you for saying it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Can I sit down for a second?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah, er... pull up a chair or sit on the shredder.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is gonna sound weird, but I think I may be the victim of a hostile work environment with this whole Pam situation.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Ah, you should probably deal with that outside of the work place.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She brought it into the work place so I feel like it has to be dealt with here.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Ok, I mean, I could talk to her.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? Would you do that?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah... that's why they pay me the big bucks. [both laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [hugs Toby, who smiles big] You're a good, good guy.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I'm good...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You know, I always knew if Michael just took the time to get to know me, we'd become friends.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [walks up to Pam's desk with a binder] Hey Pam, could I talk to you for a sec?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sure, what's up?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, I was hoping that maybe in light of everything that's happened today, it would be a good idea if today, you, me, and Michael could head into the conference room for some conflict resolution.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to Michael] What's the matter, you can't fight your own battles?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No... that's...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Maybe you could just take the rest of the day off... you know...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to Michael] Oh, would that make you feel better?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't... um... I can't hear your conversation.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You can tell Michael that I'm not leaving.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [gets up and puts a hand on Michael's shoulder] Buddy, I think that...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah, yeah-okay... you're a jackass. [to Pam] Hey, hey, you know what? You're just as stubborn as your mother, when you don't wanna do something you just don't do it.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Heh, heh, heh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, you're just her rebound!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You were right Jim, shoulda listened to you, should never have told her.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to Jim] What! You knew?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Barely, I... I don't have all the facts. Frank and Bean...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Pam storms into break room] Okay, do you want me to stop seeing your mom? Is that how we're gonna get past this? Cause, I will.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mmmmm, yes!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, that is not gonna happen!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Then why'd you even offer!?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because I assumed that you want me to be happy because I want you to be happy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, let me make this very easy for you, I could give a sh[beep] about your happiness! Stop dating my mother!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? I'm gonna start dating her even harder.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What's that supposed to mean?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what it means.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Pam storms out of the break room] Hey...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Shut it!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yep...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't need to be friends with Pam. I have plenty of female friends. My mom, Pam's mom, my aunt... although she just blocked me on IM, what's her face from Quiznos, I see her four times a week.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [walks into his office and sees the mallard back on his desk] Dwight, you brought the mallard back.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, I had to, I mean... Kelly was not even...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [speaking into the mallard and looking a Dwight] Hi buddy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [walks into Jim's office and takes out ear piece] I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: A wooden duck?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mallard. I put it in your office in order to surveil you. I was jealous that you got the promotion over me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, just to be clear, you're terrible at this and you are not equipped for espionage...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm equipped... I can...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Silence.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't tell Michael...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I won't. But, you will wash and buff our car.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Punishment fits the crime, I accept. [shakes Jim's hand and leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [leaving his office with his rum] Night everyone. Night Pam, thanks again for the rum.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Night Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Night Erin.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [in the conference room] Hey Pam, can I see you for a second? So, Dwight heard you were having a really rough day. So he generously offered to wash our car.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [looking out the window at Dwight washing the car] Awww, he did that for me?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes, he did. You know what was nice, nights swimming in Bayou bay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mmmm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Michael is seen debating on whether to come back in to the office] Remember that older couple whose kids were also named Jim and Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Haha, yeah. Say more nice things.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, we went on a Segway tour and we're awesome at it and Frank and Beans!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Maybe I'm overreacting.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah... maybe.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: But I don't think I am.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You're not, nope. Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [Ryan is walking out of the office ahead of him] Oh... where'd you get that hat?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'd rather not say.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [walks into Jims office, twists the top of the pen that he placed in Jim's pen holder which has a bug in it, pushes play] [Jim's voice] "We have our high quality 28 pound bond, our heavier 38 pound bond, or our..." [pauses recording] I've got eight hours of this. Of course I wanted Jim to find the mallard, make him feel safe. Did you really think I would put my primary listening device in a wooden mallard? I'm not insane. [starts the recording again] "...65 pound cover stock, which is the heaviest paper that will still feed smoothly through your desktop printer."
